1.speaker: RINRIN
1.japanese: お花 こちらでよろしいでしょうか

2.speaker: GIRL
2.japanese: は　はい　それでお願いします
2.english: Y-Yes, please! That would be perfect.

3.speaker: RINRIN
3.japanese: またいらしてくださいね

7.speaker: RINRIN
7.japanese: バイトお疲れ　はい　これ
7.english: You must be tired from working! Here, have these.

8.speaker: PANDA
8.japanese: まぁ もらっておくけど

10.speaker: RINRIN
10.japanese: パンダくん　つれないな
10.english: Panda... You can be so heartless.

11.speaker: RINRIN
11.japanese: あ～　パンダくん 仲よくなりたいのに
11.english: Oh, Panda. I just want to be friends with you.

12.speaker: PUPPET
12.japanese: 大丈夫　きっと仲よくなれるよ

16.speaker: RINRIN
16.japanese: はい　フローリスト リンリンです
16.english: Yes, this is Florist Rin Rin.

17.speaker: RINRIN
17.japanese: 竹をメインにしたアレンジですか
17.english: An arrangement with bamboo as the main piece?

19.japanese: で　お届けはどちらまで
19.english: Where should I deliver it to?

20.speaker: PANDA
20.japanese: リンリンてさ　困った人だよね

23.speaker: PANDA
23.japanese: そう　僕が通りかかるたびにさ
23.english: Yep. Every time I pass by...

26.speaker: RINRIN
26.japanese: パンダって　かわいいよね

27.speaker: PENGUIN
27.english: Seems like a nice guy. Really? But the panda items he gives me are so tacky.

31.speaker: PENGUIN
31.japanese: じゃあ　笹子さんにあげれば
31.english: Then why don't you give it to Miss Sasako?

33.speaker: PENGUIN
33.japanese: 気に入ってるじゃない

34.speaker: PANDA
34.japanese: リンリンて　ホント困った人だから

35.speaker: POLAR BEAR
35.japanese: 今頃パンダくんの家に行ってたりして
35.english: What if he was at your house right now?

36.speaker: PANDA
36.english: Don't say things like that. This is Panda's house.

37.speaker: RINRIN
37.japanese: お花をお届けにあがりました

39.japanese: この時間は　しろくまカフェかな
39.english: He's probably at Polar Bear's Café at this hour.

40.speaker: PANDAMAMA
40.japanese: どうも　ご苦労様です
40.english: Hello, thank you for your hard work.

42.speaker: RINRIN
42.japanese: パンダだ　パンダママだ

44.speaker: RINRIN
44.english: Y-Yes. I'll pay this separately, but would you mind rearranging the bamboo in the rooms, too?

45.speaker: RINRIN
45.japanese: お家に 上がっていいんですか！
45.english: You mean I can come into your house?!

46.speaker: PENGUIN
46.japanese: リンリンのパンダ好きは相当なものらしいよ
46.english: It seems that Rin Rin has an intense love of pandas.

47.speaker: SASAKO
47.japanese: パンダグッズも かなり集めてるそうですよ
47.english: Apparently his collection of panda merchandise is quite extensive.

48.speaker: PENGUIN
48.japanese: 花屋じゃなくて パンダグッズ屋やればよかったのに
48.english: He should have opened up a panda merchandise shop instead of a flower shop.

51.speaker: POLAR BEAR
51.japanese: 若き日のリンリンが パンダグッズを集めるため　世界を旅していた頃
51.english: When the young Rin Rin was traveling the world to collect panda merchandise,

52.speaker: POLAR BEAR
52.japanese: とある事件に巻き込まれ…
52.english: he was involved in an incident...

56.speaker: POLAR BEAR
56.japanese: ささやかな嘘で あなたの味気ない日常に彩りを
56.english: I want to bring some color into your desolate lives with a modest lie.

57.speaker: PENGUIN
57.japanese: 味気ない日常で悪かったね
57.english: Well, excuse me for having a desolate life! Let's stop talking about Rin Rin.

60.speaker: PANDAMAMA
60.english: Here, I'll pay you right now.

62.speaker: RINRIN
62.japanese: ここでパンダくんが 暮らしているんだな

65.speaker: PANDASISTER
65.japanese: ママがお茶どうぞって
65.english: Mama asked me to bring you some tea.

66.speaker: RINRIN
66.japanese: パンダだ　パンダ妹だ
66.english: It's a panda! Little Sister Panda!

68.speaker: RINRIN
68.japanese: ありがとう…　えっと…

70.speaker: MEIMEI
70.japanese: あなた　リンリンでしょ？

71.speaker: RINRIN
71.japanese: 僕のこと　知ってるんだ？

72.speaker: MEIMEI
72.japanese: イケメン花屋って街じゃ有名よ
72.english: You're famous around town as the good-looking florist.

74.speaker: MEIMEI
74.english: You're not very humble, are you?

75.speaker: MEIMEI
75.japanese: でも…　私の好みじゃないわね
75.english: But you know, you're not my type.

77.speaker: MEIMEI
77.japanese: まあ　いいわ ちょっと遊んであげる
77.english: Oh well, I'll play with you for a little while.

79.speaker: RINRIN
79.japanese: ああ　ごめん お店があるから　帰らないと
79.english: Oh, sorry, I actually need to get back to my shop...

80.speaker: PANDAMAMA
80.japanese: リンリンさん　お待たせ
80.english: Sorry to keep you waiting, Mr. Rin Rin.

84.speaker: RINRIN
84.english: I'm rolling around with a panda!

85.speaker: RINRIN
85.japanese: なんて幸せな時間なんだ…
85.english: What an amazingly happy time! Next we're going to play hide and seek. Playing hide and seek with a panda!

87.speaker: PANDAMAMA
87.japanese: リンリンさん案外タフね
87.english: Mr. Rin Rin is quite tough.

88.speaker: RINRIN
88.japanese: リンリンさん案外タフね
88.english: {\a6}three... four... five... Hey, where are you? Hey! I wonder if it's okay to keep playing and not go back to work.

89.speaker: RINRIN
89.english: It is! Because I'm with pandas!

93.speaker: MEIMEI
93.japanese: あっ　お爺ちゃん 何やってるの？
93.english: Oh, Grandpa, what are you doing?

95.speaker: MEIMEI
95.japanese: 違うわよ　リンリンは　お花屋さんよ
95.english: No, Rin Rin is a florist.

96.speaker: GRANDPA
96.japanese: ニチニチ　コレコー　ニチ…
96.english: Every day is a good day.

97.speaker: GRANDPA
97.japanese: ジョージョー　シャクリョー　セーコー　トーテー…
97.english: Consider the whole. {\a6}High pressure west, low pressure east.

98.speaker: MEIMEI
98.japanese: 都合が悪くなると すぐとぼけるんだから
98.english: You always play dumb when things go wrong. {\a6}A good and wise mother.

101.speaker: RINRIN
101.japanese: パンダお爺ちゃんの太極拳…　だ…

102.speaker: POLAR BEAR
102.english: So, it wasn't a panda merchandise store...

103.speaker: POLAR BEAR
103.japanese: 花屋を営むこととなりました
103.english: but a flower shop that he started.

104.speaker: PENGUIN
104.english: It's so sad. I know it's made up, but I still can't stop crying.

105.speaker: PANDA
105.japanese: 思わず　リンリンに 優しくしちゃいそうだよ
105.english: I may feel like being nice to Rin Rin.

107.speaker: POLAR BEAR
107.japanese: それはあの眩しくも世知辛い国でのことだった
107.english: It was there in that glaring, cruel land...

108.speaker: PENGUIN
108.japanese: いや　さすがに　もういい
108.english: No, that's enough already. Huh? Where am I?

109.speaker: RINRIN
109.japanese: イテテ…　あっ　そうか

110.japanese: パンダくんちに配達に来て　それで…
110.english: I came to deliver flowers to Panda's house and...

111.speaker: RINRIN
111.japanese: まいったな… 早く店に帰らなきゃ
111.english: This isn't good. I have to hurry and get back to the shop.

112.speaker: RINRIN
112.japanese: こ…　これは　パンダくんの…

113.speaker: RINRIN
113.japanese: もしかして　この部屋は…

115.speaker: RINRIN
115.japanese: パンダくんのベッド… パンダくんのパンダクッション

116.speaker: RINRIN
116.japanese: パンダくんのパンダスリッパ！ パンダくんのシール…
116.english: Panda's panda slippers! Panda's sticker! This is the present I gave him.

117.speaker: RINRIN
117.japanese: なんだよ… 大事にしてくれてるじゃん
117.english: He {\i1}is{\i0} taking good care of it. Baby pandas! They're so cute!

119.speaker: RINRIN
119.japanese: ダメだよ　それは観賞用だよ
119.english: No, no, that's for decoration. You're giving it to me?

121.speaker: PANDAMAMA
121.japanese: お目覚め？　ごめんなさいね
121.english: Are you awake? Sorry about that. Grandpa's a little... Oh?

122.speaker: RINRIN
122.japanese: ありがとう！　おいしいな
122.english: Thank you. It tastes really good.

123.speaker: PANDAMAMA
123.japanese: リンリン！？　それ　観賞用よ

124.speaker: PANDAMAMA
124.japanese: っていうか　笹　食べるの？
124.english: Or rather, do you eat bamboo grass?

125.speaker: RINRIN
125.japanese: えぇ　状況しだいでは

126.speaker: PANDAMAMA
126.japanese: まぁ　止めないけど…

127.speaker: PANDAMAMA
127.japanese: あの…　お花代　まだ お支払いしてなかったでしょ？
127.english: Um, I haven't paid you for the flowers yet.

128.speaker: RINRIN
128.japanese: お代はいらないので 仔パンダ　抱っこさせてください！
128.english: I don't need payment. May I just hold the baby pandas?

129.speaker: PANDAMAMA
129.english: Sure, but I'll still pay you.

130.speaker: PANDAMAMA
130.japanese: あら…　ごめんなさい

133.speaker: RINRIN
133.japanese: お花 こちらで　よろしいでしょうか？

134.speaker: GIRL
134.japanese: 厘太郎さん　どうしたのかしら？
134.english: I wonder what happened to Mr. Rintaro?

136.speaker: RINRIN
136.japanese: パンダママさんや　妹ちゃんとは 仲よくなれたんだ
136.english: {\a6}I was able to become friends with Panda's mom {\a6}and little sister.

137.speaker: RINRIN
137.japanese: 今度は　パンダお爺ちゃんと 仔パンダちゃんたち…
137.english: {\a6}Next is Panda's grandpa and the babies.

139.speaker: PANDA
139.japanese: ねぇ　ねぇ　半田さん

141.speaker: HANDA
141.japanese: 今日は　ダメ！　用事あるの
141.english: Not today. I have plans today.

142.speaker: PANDA
142.japanese: ちょっとくらい　いいじゃん

143.speaker: PANDA
143.japanese: 彼女もいないし　暇でしょ？
143.english: You don't have a girlfriend, so you should be free.

144.speaker: HANDA
144.japanese: もう…　パンダくんより 女の子に追いかけられたいよ
144.english: Jeez, I wish girls would follow me instead of you, Panda.

146.speaker: RINRIN
146.japanese: パンダくんより　だと！？

148.speaker: HANDA
148.japanese: 何か　視線を感じるんだけど…
148.english: I feel like someone's staring at me.

150.speaker: POLAR BEAR
150.japanese: クロワッサンもいけるね

151.speaker: PANDA
151.japanese: これに竹の葉を練りこんだら もっと　おいしくなるんじゃない？
151.english: I think it would taste even better if they added bamboo leaves.

153.speaker: SASAKO
153.japanese: それより　パンダあんぱん っていうのが　あるみたいだよ
153.english: More importantly, I hear they have a panda red bean bun, too. Really?

154.speaker: PANDA
154.english: Hey, Mr. Penguin. Next time, could you get the panda red bean bun, too?

156.speaker: PENGUIN
156.japanese: 僕は　別にパンを買うためにパン屋さんに 行ってるわけじゃないんだよ！
156.english: I'm not going to the bakery to buy pastries!

157.speaker: PENGUIN
157.japanese: ペン子さんを…　その…

158.speaker: PENGUIN
158.japanese: デートに誘いたいんだよ…
158.english: ask Miss Penko out on a date. I know that.

159.speaker: PANDA
159.japanese: でも　結局　いつも　パンを 買って帰ってくるだけじゃない
159.english: But every time you go, you just come back with lots of bread.

161.speaker: SASAKO
161.japanese: いっそ　告白しちゃったら どうです？
161.english: Why not just ask her out and be done with it? B-But...

162.speaker: POLAR BEAR
162.japanese: 小さな１歩を恐れるときは
162.english: When you fear taking the small step,

163.japanese: 大きな１歩を踏み出すときである
163.english: it is time to take the big step.

164.speaker: POLAR BEAR
164.japanese: フランスの古い格言だよ

165.speaker: PENGUIN
165.japanese: 大きな１歩を踏み出すとき…

169.speaker: PENGUIN
169.japanese: 決めた！　僕は　やるよ
169.english: I've made up my mind! I'm going to do it!

170.speaker: SASAKO
170.english: You're going to do it? You mean...

171.speaker: PENGUIN
171.japanese: ペン子さんに告白する！
171.english: I'm going to confess my love to Miss Penko.

173.speaker: PENGUIN
173.japanese: ごめん！　今の僕は ダジャレにつきあってる暇はないの
173.english: Sorry! I don't have time for your puns right now!

174.speaker: PENGUIN
174.japanese: 早速　行ってくるよ！

177.speaker: SASAKO
177.english: That's... heinous {\i1}(gokuaku){\i0}? Yes. But how should I do it?

180.japanese: さっき　思い立ったんだから
180.english: I just thought of doing this a second ago.

182.speaker: POLAR BEAR
182.japanese: 例えばクジャクは羽を広げて愛の告白をするよね
182.english: Well, for example, a peacock spreads its feathers as a show of affection.

187.speaker: POLAR BEAR
187.japanese: グンカンドリは赤いノド袋を膨らますらしいよ
187.english: A frigatebird inflates his red gular pouch.

188.speaker: SASAKO
188.japanese: あんまり変わりませんね
188.english: There doesn't seem to be much of a difference.

190.speaker: POLAR BEAR
190.japanese: リクガメは甲羅アタック 噛みつき マウントだよ
190.english: Tortoises attack the shell, bite, and then mount. Really? Like pro wrestling?

191.speaker: SASAKO
191.japanese: 噛みつきは反則じゃないんですか？
191.english: Wouldn't biting be against the rules?

192.speaker: PANDA
192.japanese: ワルだね　かっこいい！
192.english: How under-handed. That's so cool! Wait, Mr. Penguin doesn't have a shell.

195.speaker: PANDA
195.japanese: カッパって　なんて言って 告白するの？
195.english: What do kappas do when they confess? Hey! Help me think about this seriously! I don't know what to do anymore.

196.speaker: PENGUIN
196.japanese: 最悪だ　世界の終わりだ
196.english: This is awful. It's the end of the world.

197.speaker: SASAKO
197.japanese: や…　やっぱり　好きです　って シンプルなのがいちばんですよ
197.english: I think something simple like "I like you," is best.

198.speaker: PENGUIN
198.english: Isn't that a bit overt? But then she'll know that I like her.

199.speaker: SASAKO
199.japanese: 告白するんじゃないんですか？
199.english: I thought that was the idea. T-That's right.

200.speaker: PENGUIN
200.japanese: わかった　シンプルに頑張るよ
200.english: Okay. I'll do my best with the simplest way.

201.speaker: POLAR BEAR
201.japanese: それじゃあ　行こうか

203.speaker: POLAR BEAR
203.japanese: 昔の武将は　こう言った

204.speaker: POLAR BEAR
204.japanese: １本の矢なら折れるが ３本の矢なら折れない　と
204.english: "A single arrow may break, but three will not."

205.speaker: POLAR BEAR
205.japanese: え～っと… 三人寄れば　文殊の知恵
205.english: Well then, Three heads are better than one {\i1}(sannin yoreba monju no chie){\i0}.

207.speaker: SASAKO
207.japanese: それじゃあ 猿知恵になっちゃうよ
207.english: That would make it shallow cleverness {\i1}(sarujie){\i0}.

208.speaker: PENGUIN
208.japanese: 一人で大丈夫だから 来ないでね！
208.english: I'll be fine on my own, so stay here! I hope everything goes well.

210.japanese: これ　受け取ってください

211.speaker: PENGUIN
211.japanese: よ～し…　言える！　言えるぞ！
211.english: A-All right, I can do this. I can do this!

212.speaker: PENGUIN
212.japanese: 行くぞ…　よし　行くぞ！
212.english: Here I go. Yes, here I go!

213.speaker: PENGUIN
213.japanese: す…　好きです！ これ　受け取ってください！
213.english: I-I like you. Please, take these.

214.speaker: PENGUIN
214.english: Got it. I-I like you, Miss Penko!

215.speaker: PENGUIN
215.japanese: これ　受け取ってください！
215.english: Please, take these. I-I like you.

216.speaker: PENGUIN
216.japanese: 好きです これ　受け取ってください！
216.english: I like you. Please, take these! I like you. Please, take these!

217.speaker: PANDA
217.japanese: あれ　何？　何かのおまじない？

218.speaker: PENGUIN
218.japanese: あれ　何？　何かのおまじない？
218.english: {\a6}I like you. Please, take these! Is that some kind of magic spell?

220.japanese: それが 意味のない行為だとしても　幾度となく繰り返してしまう
220.english: will repeat actions over and over, even knowing they are senseless.

222.speaker: POLAR BEAR
222.japanese: ううん　いずれペンギンさんが作る未来の格言
222.english: No, it's an aphorism that Mr. Penguin will create in the future. I like you!

223.speaker: PENGUIN
223.japanese: やっぱり　僕に告白なんてムリなのかなぁ…
223.english: Maybe it's impossible for me to confess.

224.speaker: PENGUIN
224.japanese: もし　彼女が僕の愛を受け入れてくれたら…
224.english: If she were to accept my love...

225.speaker: PENGUIN
225.japanese: 嬉しいよ　ペン子さん

226.speaker: PENGUIN
226.japanese: 嬉しいよ　ペン子さん！

227.speaker: PENGUIN
227.japanese: おいしいよ　ペン子さん！

230.speaker: PENGUIN
230.japanese: いけない　いけない 夢の世界に浸ってしまった
230.english: That's not good, I got lost in my dream world.

231.speaker: PENGUIN
231.japanese: でも 夢が現実になる可能性はある！
231.english: But there's a possibility that my dream will become a reality.

232.speaker: PENGUIN
232.japanese: そのためにも頑張らなくっちゃ！
232.english: I have to keep trying for that reason! Thank goodness, he's finally going.

234.speaker: PENGUIN
234.english: I'm going to do it. I will!

236.speaker: PANDA
236.japanese: ペンギンさん　なかなか起きないね

239.speaker: PENGUIN
239.japanese: そうだ！ ペン子さんに告白！
239.english: That's right! I was going to confess to Miss Penko!

240.speaker: PENGUIN
240.japanese: でも　今日はやっぱやめとこうかな

241.japanese: なんか空回りしてる感じだし…
241.english: I feel like I'm going in circles.

242.speaker: PENGUIN
242.japanese: いや！　思い立ったが吉日！
242.english: No! There's no time like the present!

243.speaker: PENGUIN
243.japanese: けどなぁ なんか調子悪い気もするしな…
243.english: But then again... I don't think I'm at my best today.

244.speaker: PENGUIN
244.japanese: いやいや そんなこと言ってちゃダメだ！
244.english: No! I can't keep being so negative!

248.speaker: PENGUIN
248.japanese: えっ！？　なんで２人ともいるの？
248.english: What are you two doing here?!

249.speaker: PENGUIN
249.japanese: 来ないでって言ったのに！
249.english: I told you not to come!

250.speaker: PANDA
250.japanese: 早くしてよ 僕　もう　お腹すいたよ

252.speaker: POLAR BEAR
252.english: Are you not going to confess?

254.speaker: POLAR BEAR
254.japanese: 古きローマの詩人は言った
254.english: An old Roman poet said this: "Love and good luck lies with the hero."

256.speaker: PANDA
256.japanese: 幸運も愛も　その勇者って人の ところにあるってことだね
256.english: So good luck and love are at this hero person's place?

257.speaker: PANDA
257.english: Let's go there now. I'm {\i1}going{\i0} to Miss Penko.

260.speaker: PENGUIN
260.japanese: …って　２人とも ついてこないで！
260.english: Er, both of you, don't follow me!

261.speaker: PENGUIN
261.english: I'm going to say it. I'm going to say it!

262.speaker: PENGUIN
262.japanese: なんで いざっていうとき邪魔するの！？
262.english: Why do you always butt in at times like these?!

263.speaker: PANDA
263.japanese: パンダあんパンが気になっちゃって
263.english: I heard about their panda-shaped red bean buns.

264.speaker: PENGUIN
264.japanese: わかったよ！ 買ってきてあげるよ！
264.english: All right! I'll buy you one! So, go home! Go home, go home!

266.speaker: PANDA
266.japanese: 大丈夫かな？　ペンギンさん
266.english: I wonder if he's okay. Hey!

267.speaker: PENGUIN
267.english: I did it! I did it!

268.speaker: PANDA
268.japanese: おめでとう　ペンギンさん

269.speaker: SASAKO
269.japanese: へぇ～　じゃあ うまくいったんですね

270.speaker: PENGUIN
270.japanese: いやぁ　ホントまいっちゃう
270.english: I don't know what to say.

271.speaker: SASAKO
271.japanese: それで　ペン子さんは何て？
271.english: So what did Miss Penko say? You want to know?

272.speaker: SASAKO
272.japanese: もう　詳しく教えてくださいよ
272.english: Come on, give us the details.

273.speaker: PENGUIN
273.japanese: 実はね　ペン子さん僕の顔を 覚えててくれたみたいでね
273.english: Well, you see, Miss Penko apparently remembered me.

274.speaker: PENGUIN
274.japanese: 「よかったら　どうぞ」って　これ！
274.english: She said I could have these!

275.speaker: PENGUIN
275.japanese: なんと　サービス券もらったの！
275.english: She gave me these service tickets!

276.speaker: PENGUIN
276.japanese: ちょっと多めにって３枚も
276.english: She said I could have extra, so she gave me three!

277.speaker: PENGUIN
277.japanese: ねっ　サービス券をサービスだよ！
277.english: She gave me extra service tickets!

279.speaker: PENGUIN
279.japanese: それどころじゃないよ！

280.speaker: PENGUIN
280.japanese: なんと受け取るときにちょっと手が触れちゃったんだよ
280.english: I sort of touched her hand when she gave me these!

281.speaker: PENGUIN
281.japanese: どうしよう　もう手洗わない！
281.english: What should I do? I'm not washing my hand!

282.speaker: PENGUIN
282.japanese: 洗えないよ！　洗いたくないよ！
282.english: I'm not washing my hands! I don't want to wash my hands! Um...

283.speaker: POLAR BEAR
283.japanese: １枚のサービス券は　サービス券だが
283.english: One service ticket is a service ticket, but three service tickets...

284.speaker: PENGUIN
284.japanese: ３枚なら…　やっぱりサービス券だ
284.english: {\a6}I don't want to use them! Don't want to use them! ...are just service tickets.

285.speaker: SASAKO
285.japanese: それを言っちゃダメですよ

289.speaker: PANDA
289.japanese: ペンギンさん　ペンギンさん　ペンギンさん
289.english: Mr. Penguin, Mr. Penguin, Mr. Penguin!

290.speaker: PENGUIN
290.japanese: いつもは二回呼ぶのに今日はどうしたの？
290.english: You usually only say my name twice, what's wrong?

292.speaker: PANDA
292.japanese: ペンギンさんとの退屈な時間に少しだけでも刺激が欲しかったんだよ
292.english: I just wanted a little excitement in my boring times with you.

293.speaker: PENGUIN
293.english: You don't hold back, do you? Let's figure out why I'm so bored when I'm with you.

294.speaker: PENGUIN
294.japanese: いいよ　それは　白熊君　終わって
294.english: Let's not. Polar Bear, finish this.

295.speaker: POLAR BEAR
295.japanese: 次回のしろくまカフェは

296.speaker: POLAR BEAR
296.japanese: 30秒に縮小してお送りします
296.english: ...will be presented in 30 seconds. How about 30 minutes?
